usefulItems: bowl, kitchen towel, silicone bread mat, large bowl, baking tray (20 x 30 cm), pastry brush, oven
title: Vadouvan spiced mini rolls

ingredients.content: 200 g red onion, cut into quarters
30 g olive oil, plus extra for brushing

preparations.content: Place onion into mixing bowl and chop <b>8 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, salt, vinegar and sugar and cook <b>10 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Scrape base of mixing bowl with spatula and cook <b>7 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, <b>without measuring cup<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside to cool. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place all Vadouvan spice mix ingredients into mixing bowl and toast <b>6 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>, <b>without measuring cup<b>.
<b>Insert measuring cup<b>. Mill <b>1 min/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Do not clean mixing bowl.
Place water and yeast into mixing bowl and heat <b>2 min/37°C/speed 2<b>.

Add salt, flour and oil and knead <b>2 min/<b>. Transfer onto a silicone bread mat or into an oiled bowl and cover with a kitchen towel. Leave to prove in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.

Divide dough into 20 equal portions (approx. 40 g each) and flatten slightly. Place 1 teaspoon of the reserved onion mixture into centre of each dough portion, then enclose to seal and shape into a smooth ball. Place onto a baking tray (20 x 30 cm) with edges of rolls just touching.
Brush rolls lightly with oil, then sprinkle generously with Vadouvan spice mix.

Place rolls into a cold oven and turn temperature to 190°C. When temperature reaches 190°C, cook for a further 10 minutes (190°C), or until rolls sound hollow when tapped. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Double or triple onion quantities to make enough for burger and hot dog toppings.
Remaining Vadouvan spice mix can be stored in a sealable jar in a cool, dry place. Use it as a curry spice base, or add to soups, butter, marinades and dressings.
Serve these rolls with the Yoghurt soup cups (refer to the recipe on this recipe chip).
Make larger rolls for sit-down dinner parties.
